title: OBSOLETE - Events carousel - swipe
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is in a viewport at or below 767px
AND events carousel has appeared
custom_expected: THEN user cannot swipe events in the carousel on a tablet or mobile device

title: OBSOLETE - Events carousel appearance: responsive
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on main page
AND events carousel has appeared
AND carousel has more than one event element
custom_expected:
THEN automatic slide continues to occur every 5 seconds
AND images shrink in proportion - they are not squished
AND event labels and See Event button stay in position
AND no element overlaps any other

title: OBSOLETE - Events carousel: See Event button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the main page
AND the carousel has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps a SEE EVENT button
custom_expected: THEN user is redirected within the same tab to the individual event page matching the selection

title: OBSOLETE - Events carousel appearance
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is in a viewport at or above 768px
AND user is on the main page
custom_expected:
THEN at the top of the center section is a carousel
AND the carousel has a white border
AND the left and right edges of the border align with the left and right edges of the white portlet below the carousel
AND the carousel has gray left and right nav arrows
AND the element that appears in the carousel has an image
AND the image is proportional (not stretched or squished)
AND the lower third of the image has a transparent white overlay
AND horizontally centered in the white overlay is a dark blue label: top line - event name, bottom line - event occurrence (MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm AM/PM - MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm AM/PM)
AND below the label is a blue button with a white border
AND the button is labeled in white all-caps: SEE EVENT

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19379)

title: OBSOLETE - Events carousel function: automatic slide
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the main page
AND events carousel has appeared
AND carousel has more than one event element
custom_expected:
THEN the visible event element slides left offscreen
AND the next event element slides left into the frame

title: OBSOLETE - Events carousel function: manual slide
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the main page
AND events carousel has appeared
AND carousel has more than one event element
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps the left nav arrow 
OR user clicks or taps on the right nav arrow
custom_expected:
THEN the carousel slides to the previous event (for the left arrow)
OR carousel slides to the next event (for the right arrow)

title: Events carousel function: click or tap image
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on main page
AND events carousel has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps anywhere on an event image (but not the event title, See Event button, or nav arrows)
custom_expected: THEN nothing happens - image is not linked.

title: Featured Chatter function: hover over chatter name
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on main page
AND Featured Chatter appears
custom_steps: WHEN user hovers cursor over a chatter name
custom_expected: THEN cursor changes from arrow to pointing hand

title: Featured Chatter function: hover over other elements
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on main page
AND Featured Chatter has appeared
custom_steps:
WHEN user hovers cursor over Featured Baseball Chatter header
OR user hovers cursor over image
OR user hovers cursor over department label
custom_expected: THEN cursor does not change to pointing hand - those elements are not linked.

title: Apps section function: hover over logo and name
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on main page
AND Apps section has loaded
custom_steps:
WHEN user hovers cursor over logo
OR user hovers cursor over app name
custom_expected: THEN cursor changes from arrow to pointing hand

title: Apps section function: hover over header and type label
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on main page
AND Apps section has loaded
custom_steps:
WHEN user hovers cursor over Apps header
OR user hovers cursor over app type label
custom_expected: THEN cursor does not change to pointing hand - those elements are not linked.

title: Select Featured Event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on main page
AND a Featured Event as appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the event name or photo
custom_expected: THEN page redirects in the same tab to the event page corresponding to the clicked or tapped name

title: Select Featured Blog Post
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on main page
AND a Featured Blog Post has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on a blog post name or photo
custom_expected: THEN page redirects within the same tab to the relevant blog post

title: Select Featured App
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on main page
AND a Featured App has appeared
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks on logo
OR user clicks on app name
custom_expected:
THEN a new tab opens
AND page loads in that new tab
AND the page corresponds to the app that was clicked upon
AND page is a login page
AND clicking on app name and logo produce the same new page

custom_expected:
THEN they look like the photo below:

title: Scroll bar appearance
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on any page in the site
custom_expected: THEN a scroll bar appears on the right side

title: Scroll bar: automatic function
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on any page in the site
AND scroll bar has appeared
custom_steps:
WHEN user uses scroll function on mouse
OR user uses arrow keys on keyboard
custom_expected:
THEN main page moves up or down accordingly
AND scroll bar moves up or down in sync with main page

title: Scroll bar: manual function
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on any page in the site
AND scroll bar has appeared
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks and holds or presses on the scroll bar
AND user moves up or down
custom_expected:
THEN scroll bar moves up or down accordingly
AND main page scrolls up or down accordingly

title: Test responsiveness
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on a desktop platform
custom_steps:
WHEN user decreases the viewport
AND WHEN user expands the viewport
custom_expected:
THEN all elements continue to appear on the page
AND no elements overlap any other in any viewport
AND images stay proportionate (not stretched or squished)
AND all elements function as expected.

Note: In Windows IE and Edge, Chatter images will be stretched.

title: Test mobile
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is using a mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN all elements appear on the page
AND no elements overlap any other
AND all elements function as expected
